meanings.definition: The act of consigning or delivering something for preservation or safekeeping.
meanings.sent1: The consignation of valuable documents to the bank vault ensured their safety.
meanings.sent2: The consignation of the family heirlooms to the museum was a wise decision.
meanings.sent3: The consignation of the cookies in the jar led to a mysterious disappearance.
meanings.sent4: Her consignation of memories in her diary kept them safe from forgetfulness.
meanings.sent5: The consignation of secrets in the locked box was a symbol of trust.

meanings.definition: The act of assigning or entrusting something to a particular person or group.
meanings.sent1: The consignation of the task to the most capable team member ensured its success.
meanings.sent2: His consignation of the responsibility to his assistant lightened his workload.
meanings.sent3: The consignation of the class pet to the students brought joy to the classroom.
meanings.sent4: Her consignation of the leadership role to her friend showed her trust in them.
meanings.sent5: The consignation of the treasure map to the young explorer sparked excitement.

meanings.definition: The act of marking or designating something for a specific purpose or destination.
meanings.sent1: The consignation of the boxes with labels made the moving process easier.
meanings.sent2: His consignation of the tools to the designated area kept the workshop organized.
meanings.sent3: The consignation of the plants with colorful tags added a touch of creativity to the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her consignation of the books to different shelves created a sense of order in the library.
meanings.sent5: The consignation of the packages with special stickers ensured they reached the right recipients.
